business.headline: Sensex, Nifty hit record high as rally extends for 5th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex rose to an all-time high of 85,333.23 in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed to 26,056.

Hyundai to Swiggy: 5 big IPOs set to light up Dalal Street before 2024 endsFrom Hyundai Motors' massive offering to Swiggy's much-anticipated debut, the year's final IPOs could be the most exciting ones yet.

Sensex, Nifty hit record high as power and financial stock drive market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 255.83 points to end at 85,169.87, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.75 points to close at 26,004.15.

PNB, SBI, UCO: JM Financial lists 11 PSU bank stocks worth buying after selloffSince reaching its 52-week high, the PSU Bank index has dropped by 15%, with banks like UCO Bank, Bank of India (BOI), Indian Overseas Bank (IOB), and Union Bank of India seeing sharper declines of 25-30%.

Easy Trip Planners shares plunge 20% to record low. Here's what happenedThe steep decline in share price was triggered by news that promoter Nishant Pitti plans to sell 15 crore shares, representing 8.5% of the company's total share capital, in a block deal.

Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat see lowest youth unemployment, Kerala strugglesMadhya Pradesh and Gujarat have emerged as the best performers, boasting the lowest youth unemployment rates, while Kerala struggles with one of the highest.

Coldplay mania: Mumbai hotel rates up by 300% for concert weekendWith Coldplay set to perform at DY Patil Stadium on January 18-19 and 21, 2025, hotel prices in Mumbai have skyrocketed, which might leave fans scrambling for accommodation.

Explained: Why Reliance Power shares hit 5% upper circuit today Reliance Power stock: What's behind the fresh rally? Investors are buzzing as the company makes big moves—find out what's driving the surge.

Salaried employees work longer hours than casual workers, finds surveyFor many corporate workers, these 48-hour weeks translate to roughly 9 hours of work each day if they're working five days a week, or 8 hours if it's a six-day work week.
Hyundai IPO gets Sebi clearence. Check expected listing date The company submitted its draft papers in June 2024 and the IPO may be launched as soon as October.
KRN Heat Exchanger IPO opens for bidding: Subscribe or skip? The IPO of KRN Heat Exchanger is entirely a fresh issue of 1.55 crore shares and will be open for subscription till September 27.

Gold, silver price today, September 25, 2024: Yellow metal trades higher, silver records dip on MCXGold Price Today 25 September 2024: Gold is trading on the higher side while silver rates have recorded a dip on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Wednesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Foxconn eyes $1 billion display module plant in Tamil Nadu: ReportThis will be the first display module facility Foxconn has built in India, and it is expected to mainly support the production of Apple's iPhones.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as investors take breather after record runThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 20.70 points to 84,893.34 at 10:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 18.20 points to trade at 25,922.20.

Shankh Air ready for takeoff: All you need to know about India's new airlineShankh Air, owned by Shankh Aviation Private Limited, has been granted a No Objection Certificate (NOC) by the ministry, valid for three years.

Sensex crosses 85,000, Nifty hits 26,000: Will bull run continue on D-Street? While Sensex and Nifty closed below record highs amid volatility, analysts remain cautiously optimistic, noting that Indian equities have defied global uncertainty to post strong gains this year.

Sensex, Nifty dip after hitting record highs; Tata Steel jumps 4%The Sensex settled 14.57 points lower at 84,929.25 after crossing 85,000 for the first time, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 1.35 points higher at 25,940.40 after crossing 26,000.

NPS Vatsalya: Is it the right choice for parents?Unlike other financial products aimed at short-term goals like education or marriage, NPS Vatsalya focusses solely on long-term retirement savings for the child.

Western Carriers shares list at 1% discount. Should you hold or sell? Western Carriers market listing: The company's stock opened at Rs 170 on the BSE, which is 1.16% below its issue price of Rs 172. On the NSE, the shares listed at Rs 171, down by Rs 1, or 0.6%.

Explained: Why Exxaro Tiles shares jumped over 18% todayThe company stock price rose as much as 18.4% to Rs 94.96 in early trade. At 2 pm, shares of Exxaro Tiles were trading 17.24% higher at Rs 94.25.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 1 dead as rain paralyses Mumbai, schools shut today, more showers expectedMumbai rain: One person drowned in an overflowing drain in Mumbai as heavy rain battered the city and affected local train and flight operations. However, the situation returned to normal as rain stopped.

Israel prepares for Lebanon ground offensive as Biden warns of 'all-out war'More than 600 people have been reportedly killed in Lebanon since Israel began an intense campaign on Monday to destroy Hezbollah infrastructure. As per UN figures, some 90,000 people in Lebanon have been newly displaced.

Temple defaced in US with 'Hindus go back' message, 2nd incident in 10 daysThe Sacremento Police said that the vandalism incident was being classified as a "hate crime". Police added that the accused also cut water lines at the property.

Suspect in Bengaluru woman's murder found dead in Odisha, suicide note recoveredA purported suicide note was found inside a notebook in which the suspect confessed to murdering the Bengaluru woman and chopping her body into pieces.

After Coldplay-BookMyShow mess, make reselling concert tickets illegal in IndiaBookMyShow has launched a police investigation into the 'third-party' apps that allowed people and dealers to resell Coldplay concert tickets at inflated prices – up to Rs 7.7 lakh for a ticket originally priced at Rs 12,500.

Will blow your country to smithereens: Trump blasts Iran amid death threatsFormer US President Donald Trump said Iran will be "blown to smithereens" if the Islamic country is involved in assassination attempts on former presidents and presidential candidates.

Putin warns West of nuclear attack over airstrikes on Russia from UkraineRussian President Vladimir Putin stated that Russia may use nuclear weapons in case of a nuclear attack by an enemy or a conventional attack that threatens the existence of the state.

Anti-collision system 'Kavach' undergoes successful trial, passes 7 key testsRailway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw travelled in the engine of a Kavach-fitted train, which, while speeding at 130 kmph, stopped 50 metres before the red signal on its own without any manual interference by the loco pilot.

Watch: Shah Rukh Khan gets mobbed at airport, fans scream in excitementShah Rukh Khan was mobbed at the Mumbai airport as he left for Abu Dhabi to host IIFA 2024. SRK will be hosting the grand event along with Karan Johar and Vicky Kaushal.

More leadership drama at OpenAI, Mira Murati and two others leave while Sam Altman says thank youOpenAI undergoes significant leadership changes as CTO Mira Murati and two senior leaders depart, marking a major transition for the company.

NCP was Ajit Pawar's to keep but he chose to disrupt our lives: Supriya SuleSpeaking about Ajit Pawar, whose rebellion led to the division of the NCP, Supriya Sule said she was happy to give the mantle of the party to him, but he chose to go the wrong way.

Siddaramaiah reacts as court orders Lokayukta FIR in Muda 'scam': Not afraidSiddaramaiah said the matter has been referred to the Mysuru Lokayukta police by the Special Court because the complaint was lodged in Mysuru and MUDA is also located in that city.
Kiran Rao shares how fresh faces in Laapataa Ladies worked in their favourDirector Kiran Rao recently spoke about her film Laapataa Ladies and why she cast fresh faces in it.

Records in RG Kar rape case were altered at police station, CBI tells courtDuring the hearing, the CBI claimed that during the interrogation of both accused, additional facts had emerged which show some false records pertaining to the case were created or altered in the Tala Police Station.

Video: Biden forgets he's in New York, welcomes world leaders to Washington Addressing the gathering of world leaders at the InterContinental New York Barclay hotel, Biden stated, "Thank you, thank you, thank you. Welcome to Washington."

Is Congress keeping political pot simmering over Chief Minister's face in Haryana?Congress in Haryana faces internal strife over ticket distribution, with tensions mounting between Bhupinder Singh Hooda and Kumari Selja, as the party attempts to project unity ahead of the Assembly elections.

Inspired by Bishan Singh Bedi: Yuvraj Singh opens up on his coaching mantraIndia great Yuvraj Singh revealed how his coaching philosophy draws inspiration from his late mentor Bishan Singh Bedi. Yuvraj continues to impart Bedi's principles while mentoring young talents like Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma in the evolving world of cricket.

Ready for ground operation in Lebanon against Hezbollah if needed: Israeli envoyIsrael's Ambassador to India, Reuven Azar, spoke about Israel's goals in the ongoing military operations in Lebanon and nearly a year-long war with Hamas.

Two cops arrested in Kolkata for threatening, extorting money from cab driverAccording to a complaint from the car driver, the accused policemen sought four lakh rupees from him. They also threatened to implicate the cab driver in a false case if he failed to provide the amount.

Rapper 50 Cent to make documentary on Diddy assault allegations for Netflix50 Cent is producing a Netflix docuseries on Sean 'Diddy' Combs' assault allegations, aiming to give a voice to victims. Combs remains in custody amid multiple lawsuits.

Rekha's new airport look is just another proof she will forever be a style iconRekha was clicked at the Mumbai airport this morning. She made a stylish appearance and yet again proved that she is an evergreen style icon. The actor was seen in a black ensemble with an ivory scarf wrapped around her neck. She also rocked a black turban-like headgear. It was quite reminiscent of her glam diaries in the film Khoon Bhari Maang. This was the veteran actor's rare public appearance. She was accompanied by her secretary, Farzana.

Live: Amit Shah to lead BJP's Jammu campaign, Rahul Gandhi in Haryana todayHaryana, J&K Election News Live Updates: Top BJP leaders, including Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, Home Minister Amit Shah, Smriti Irani, and JP Nadda, are set to campaign in Jammu's key Hindu-majority districts starting Thursday. With polls approaching in BJP strongholds like Jammu, Samba, Kathua, and Udhampur, the party is pulling out all the stops. Yogi Adityanath will lead three rallies, while Amit Shah is expected to make appearances at four locations. Meanwhile, Smriti Irani will address two public meetings. In a parallel push, Rahul Gandhi will be in Haryana today, rallying for Congress in Karnal and Hisar districts ahead of the October 5 Assembly polls. Stay tuned at India Today for latest updates regarding Haryana and J&K Assembly elections.

NRI quota in MBBS: Supreme Court ruling nips Karnataka's plan in the budKarnataka's Medical Education Minister stated that the Supreme Court verdict cancelling the NRI quota expansion will have no immediate implications for the state, as it is also planning a similar increase.

Delhi High Court slams Muslim's body for opposing Rani Lakshmibai statue in parkWhile rejecting a plea from Delhi's Shahi Idgah Managing Committee, the court came down heavily on the body, saying that history should not be divided on communal grounds and that Rani Lakshmibai is a national hero.

KBC 16: Chander Parkash, 22, becomes 1st crorepati on Big B's showThe latest episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati 16 turned special after contestant Chander Parkash became the first crorepati of the season. He even won a car.

Arijit Singh reacts after security grabs female fan by neck at UK concert: Not fairSinger Arijit Singh apologised to a woman at his UK concert after security held her by the neck. He told her that he wished he could protect her.

Video: Shah Rukh Khan leaves for Abu Dhabi ahead of IIFA 2024Shah Rukh Khan was clicked at the airport on September 26 as he headed to Abu Dhabi, where he is set to host IIFA 2024 alongside Karan Johar and Vicky Kaushal.

Rapper 50 Cent to make documentary on Diddy assault allegations for Netflix50 Cent is producing a Netflix docuseries on Sean 'Diddy' Combs' assault allegations, aiming to give a voice to victims. Combs remains in custody amid multiple lawsuits.

sports.headline: New National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru almost ready: Dilip VengsarkarDilip Vengsarkar, former India captain and BCCI Apex Council member, expressed his satisfaction with the 'almost ready' National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru. The NCA, featuring modern facilities, will be inaugurated later this week.

Barcelona still a work in progress despite great start in LaLiga: Hansi Flick FC Barcelona have started the La Liga season with seven consecutive victories, but manager Hansi Flick believes there's still room for improvement, despite their hard-fought 1-0 win over Getafe on Wednesday.

Going to take another 10 years to produce a Grand Slam champion: Leander PaesTennis legend Leander Paes believes India needs a decade and a grassroots transformation to produce a Grand Slam champion. Speaking at the Tennis Premier League auction, he stressed the importance of nurturing young talent and tapping into rural areas.

Kanpur curator hints pitch to favour both pace and spin in 2nd TestIndia vs Bangladesh: Green Park curator Shiv Kumar revealed that the pitch for the second Test will offer a balanced contest for both pacers and spinners. The pitch is expected to provide bounce and movement for fast bowlers in the early stages and favour spinners from Day 3 onwards.

Didn't have inspiration to play IPL and domestic cricket: Shikhar DhawanFormer India opener Shikhar Dhawan revealed that he didn't have the "inspiration" left to take the domestic cricket route for a place in the national side.

Yuvraj continues to impart Bedi's principles while mentoring young talents like Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma in the evolving world of cricket.

Eriksen's strike cancelled as Manchester United draw vs TwenteEuropa League: Manchester United kicked off their 2024/25 campaign with a 1-1 draw against FC Twente at Old Trafford. Christian Eriksen's stunning goal was cancelled out by Sam Lammers' equaliser, leaving United with just a point.

Bangladesh start rigorous training before all-important Kanpur TestIND vs BAN: Najmul Hossain Shanto's men have started training hard in a bid to make a comeback in the second Test against India, starting September 27 at the Green Park in Kanpur.

Ben Stokes 'on track' for England comeback after hamstring injuryPAK vs ENG: Ben Stokes underwent scans on his hamstring and results showed that he is well on track to recover for England's Test series against Pakistan, starting October 7.

India women welcomed by Rana Daggubati on Dubai arrival T20 World Cup: Actor Rana Daggubati greeted the Harmanpreet Kaur-led Indian women's team on their arrival in Dubai. India are scheduled to begin their campaign on October 4 against New Zealand.

India women welcomed by Rana Daggubati on Dubai arrival T20 World Cup: Actor Rana Daggubati greeted the Harmanpreet Kaur-led Indian women's team on their arrival in Dubai. India are scheduled to begin their campaign on October 4 against New Zealand.

IND vs BAN: Akash Deep in awe of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's dedicationIndia pacer Akash Deep revealed how sharing the dressing room with Indian cricket stars left him inspired by the dedication and hard work of superstars like Virat Kohli and skipper Rohit Sharma. He praised their thought process, hailing it as being on a different level than anyone else.

Akash Deep not feeling Australia selection pressure : I live in the presentIndia pacer Akash Deep remains focused on the present, not letting pressure affect him ahead of a potential Border Gavaskar Trophy selection. He continues to prioritize the Bangladesh series, following his impressive performances since debuting earlier this year.

He makes things simple: Akash Deep hails 'supportive' Rohit SharmaIND vs BAN: Speedster Akash Deep said that captain Rohit Sharma gives enough support to the Indian cricketers and makes life simpler for them.

Vinesh Phogat served whereabouts failure notice by anti doping agencyParis Olympics 2024: Vinesh Phogat has been served a whereabouts failure notice by National Anti-Doping Agency (NADA) for reportedly not being available for a dope test on September 9 at her house in Sonepat.

Navdeep Singh, Avani, Sumit on inspiring journey to Paralympics gloryIndia's Paralympic medallists—Avani Lekhara, Navdeep Singh, and Sumit Antil—shared their inspirational journeys to glory during India Today's Mumbai Conclave 2024. They opened up about overcoming the challenges posed by their disabilities to achieve remarkable success on the world stage.

Took me two years to accept myself: Paralympian Sumit recalls accidentParalympics 2024: Sumit Antil went down the memory lane to the times when he met with an accident back in 2015. The 26-year-old para-athlete bagged the gold medal in Paris with a throw of 70.59 metres, also breaking his own Paralympics record twice.

Paralympics star Avani Lekhara reveals return to driving after accidentParalympic gold medallist Avani Lekhara shared her inspiring journey of conquering her fear of driving after a life-changing accident. Avani Lekhara inspired millions after defending her 10m Air Rifle SH1 title at the 2024 Paralympics.

People called me mini Kohli: Navdeep on viral Paralympics celebration videoParis Paralympics star Navdeep Singh recalled that people started calling him mini Virat Kohli after his celebration video went viral on social media. Navdeep won gold medal in Paralympics 2024.

People called me mini Kohli: Navdeep on viral Paralympics celebration videoParis Paralympics star Navdeep Singh recalled that people started calling him mini Virat Kohli after his celebration video went viral on social media. Navdeep won gold medal in Paralympics 2024.

Watch: PM Modi enjoys Pragg vs Arjun chess game, hosts Olympiad winnersPrime Minister Narendra Modi hosted India's Chess Olympiad champions, celebrating their historic double victory in Budapest. PM Modi felicitated stars like D Gukesh and Divya Deshmukh, engaging with them and enjoying a special match between Praggnanandhaa and Arjun Erigaisi.

Armless archer Sheetal Devi recalls support from academy in heartfelt postParis Paralympics bronze medallist Sheetal Devi recalled support from her academy in her early days of archery. The armless archer has been one of fan favourites since bursting onto the archery scene.

Where is Dhoka Cup Talent? Ghulam left out of squad, Shahzad slams PCBPAK vs ENG: Ahmed Shehzad slammed PCB for leaving out Kamran Ghulam and Mohammad Ali for the opening Test against England to be held in Multan.

Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir inspect Kanpur pitch ahead of 2nd TestThe Indian team went straight to training a day after reaching Kanpur on September 24. Rohit Sharma and Gautam Gambhir had a long look at the wicket ahead of the 2nd Test match against Bangladesh.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
